name: The Anti-Prism
tagline: Patches of grey bushes, flowers, and skeletal trees stand out against the otherwise verdant forest.

procedural.encounter_notes: Encountered creatures or people are 3-in-6 likely to be afflicted with the Grey Blight
procedural.foraging_results: Successful foraging yields 1d3 portions of Parson's Gobble (p430), in addition to the normal results

description: Patches of grey bushes, flowers, and skeletal trees stand out against the otherwise verdant forest.

points_of_interest.name: The Anti-Prism
points_of_interest.description: In the north-west of this hex, Harrid's Path passes through a region, half a mile in diameter, where all the colours of the forest bleed away into monochrome. Trees are bare and undergrowth is wilted. All sounds of nature are silenced, save a low, pulsing hum.
points_of_interest.interior: At the centre of the greyness, a giant, transparent crystal juts 20′ from the earth. A psychedelic mixture of colours swirls inside it, undulating like ink in water.

roll_tables.name: Coloured Heart
roll_tables.description: Roll when struck by a beam from the Anti-Prism

entries.title: Red—Anger
entries.description: Infuriated by even the most minor inconvenience. Any time the character is slighted in any way, they must make a Charisma Check or turn violent.
entries.mechanical_effect: Must make Charisma Check or turn violent when slighted

entries.title: Orange—Overconfidence
entries.description: Rushes headlong into any danger that presents itself.

entries.title: Yellow—Happiness
entries.description: Filled with joy. Permanent uncanny smile and laughter at inappropriate times.
entries.mechanical_effect: Permanent uncanny smile and inappropriate laughter

entries.title: Green—Disgust
entries.description: Always feels sickened and is visibly off put by anything unusual. Must make a Save Versus Hold to keep any food down.
entries.mechanical_effect: Save Versus Hold to keep food down

entries.title: Blue—Sadness
entries.description: The character only sees the worst in any situation. Their followers must make daily Morale Checks or depart.
entries.mechanical_effect: Followers make daily Morale Checks or depart

entries.title: Violet—Fear
entries.description: Paranoid. The character automatically fails any Morale Checks or Saving Throws against fear.
entries.mechanical_effect: Automatically fails Morale Checks and Saving Throws against fear

special_features.name: Touching the prism
special_features.description: A character who touches the prism must Save Versus Spell or contract the Grey Blight. An arcane spell-caster who successfully saves gains an arcane insight into the very nature of colour and the body, and may copy the spell Transparency (p457) into a spell book.

special_features.name: Striking the prism
special_features.description: Beams of colour flash out towards the attacker. They and anyone within 10′ of them must Save Versus Ray or be struck by a beam and be afflicted with a Coloured Heart.

special_features.name: The Grey Blight
special_features.description: Victims of the colour-sapping powers of the Anti-Prism have all colour drained from their bodies. They are dull, emotionless husks of their former selves, unable to act of their own will and easily suggestible. Afflicted people have their entire bodies (including clothing and possessions) grey and are listless zombies, unwilling to speak, unable to do more than sigh. Afflicted animals and monsters have completely grey furs, feathers, or skins and appear lethargic and depressed. Cure: Magic of curse removal, immersing the victim in a rainbow, or afflicting them with a Coloured Heart.

special_features.name: The Coloured Heart
special_features.description: The opposite of the Grey Blight, this much rarer condition alters a victim's personality based on the colour of the beam that strikes them. Cure: Magic of curse removal, keeping the victim in complete darkness for 24 uninterrupted hours, or afflicting them with the Grey Blight.
